title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Betmai Hydroelectric Project, through Knight Piesold

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Sewa Energy Resources (SL) Ltd. of Sierra Leone will fund a feasibility study to determine the viability of a 27 megawatt run-of-river hydropower project at Betmai Falls on the Pampana River. The Study is expected to have positive developmental, social, and economic impacts in Sierra Leone, and create an opportunity for U.S. companies to provide goods, services, and expertise to the development of the Sierra Leone energy market. The Grantee has selected Knight Piesold and Co. of Denver, Colorado to perform the feasibility study.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - WindGen Village and Commerical and Industrial Minigrids, through WindGen Power USA

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Ministry of Energy of the Government of Sierra Leone will fund a feasibility study to evaluate the technical, economic, and commercial viability of providing approximately five minigrids for commercial and industrial users (e.g., factories and commercial farms, telecom towers, universities, government buildings) and surrounding communities and approximately 40 minigrids for villages. These minigrids will potentially provide energy access to over 8,600 people, promoting a higher quality of life and economic development. The Study will also create an opportunity for U.S. companies to provide goods, services, and expertise. The Grantee has selected WindGen Power USA, Inc. of Delray Beach, Florida to perform the Study and help implement the Project.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (isolated mini-grids)

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

These minigrids will potentially provide energy access to over 8,600 people, promoting a higher quality of life and economic development. The Study will also create an opportunity for U.S. companies to provide goods, services, and expertise.

title.narrative: Western Area Gas Power Generation Project, through Solidaris, LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for CECA SL Generation Limited (Grantee), a privately-owned company in Sierra Leone, to develop an approximately 83.5 megawatt combined cycle gas power generation plant in Freetown, Sierra Leone (Project). When implemented, the Project will provide critical reliable and affordable energy to the people of Sierra Leone. The Grantee selected Princeton Energy Resources International as the sole-source contractor for the Study.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Hybrid Power Generation in Nitti, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (Study) for the development of an approximately 192 megawatt hybrid power generation plant near the village of Nitti in Sierra Leone (Project). The Study will assess how best to maximize the use of solar photovoltaic energy and provide reliable power generation. Because the Project has the potential to pair solar with natural gas power generation, the Study will analyze credible lower and zero-carbon alternatives to natural gas use in accordance with the Executive Order on Tackling the Climate Crisis at Home and Abroad (E.O. 14008).

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Hybrid Power Generation in Nitti, through Inglett & Stubbs International, LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (FS) for the development of an approximately 192 Megawatt (MW) hybrid power generation plant near the village of Nitti in Sierra Leone. The Study will assess how best to maximize the use of solar photovoltaic energy and provide reliable power generation. Because the Project has the potential to pair solar with natural gas power generation, the Study will analyze credible lower and zero-carbon alternatives to natural gas use in accordance with the Executive Order (EO) on Tackling the Climate Crisis at Home and Abroad (E.O. 14008). The Sierra Leone Ministry of Energy, on behalf of the Government of the Republic of Sierra Leone, is the proposed grantee. The proposed contractor is Inglett & Stubbs International, Limited Liability Corporation (LLC).

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Supplementary Studies for Betmai Hydroelectric Project Feasibility Study, through Knight Piesold

description.narrative: This grant to Sewa Energy Resources Sociedad Limitada Limited funds supplementary engineering and environmental studies to increase Sierra Leone's baseload renewable energy through the implementation of a 27-megawatt run-of-river hydroelectric plant at Betmai Falls on the Pampana River in Sierra Leone, for which USTDA already provided a feasibility study. U.S. firm Knight Pisold and Company will carry out the feasibility study on a sole-source basis.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Africell Network Expansion Feasibility Study, through Decision/Analysis Partners, LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study that supports the expansion of Africell Sierra Leone Limited's network through the implementation of a 1,600 kilometer fiber backbone network nationwide and the expansion of fixed broadband, including fiber and fixed wireless, networks in up to 32 cities and towns in Sierra Leone.

title.narrative: 5 MW Solar Photovoltaic (PV) and 30 MW PV Hybrid Power Plants, through Power Engineers, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant in support of Solar Era Holdings (SL) Limited (Grantee) to fund a feasibility study (Study) to assess the technical, financial and economic viability of a five MW solar photovoltaic power plant as well as a planned second phase expansion to a 30 MW solar hybrid plant near Bo, the second largest city in Sierra Leone (Project). The U.S. firm Power Engineers, Incorporated will perform the Study. The Study will provide the Grantee with information and analyses that offer a blueprint for implementing both phases of the Project on a commercially and technically viable basis. This Project would bring badly needed energy into the grid in Sierra Leone, where at present only 13 percent of the population has access to electricity.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

The Study will provide the Grantee with information and analyses that offer a blueprint for implementing both phases of the Project on a commercially and technically viable basis.
